name: The Varsity
address: 61 North Avenue NW, Atlanta, GA 30308, USA

reviews.text: We went here while on a road trip.  We heard it was a stop we had to make.  I'm glad we did for the nostalgia,  the food, however,  left me wanting.  I ordered a double cheeseburger,  onion rings and a frosted orange.  My husband got the 2 chili dog deal with fries and a coke.  He liked the chili on his dogs very much.  It had a little spice to it.  The fries were very good as well.  My hamburger came with 2 patties in a squished down bun and one slice of cheese not even melted.  The patties were warm,  not hot and there was nothing on it at all.  The onion rings were so greasy I could only eat 3 before my stomach was upset.  The frozen orange was too thick to drink,  but once it thawed a bit it was tasty.  We also ordered a peach pie.  It had very little peach in it and the crust was tough and chewy. The young man who took out order was nice,  but not welcoming.  Got down to business. The building is very clean and plenty of seating.  They have metal toilets in the bathroom.  🙂  i can say i went,  but i don't think i have to go back.  .

Pretty iconic spot. We thought this was a drive through but it didn't turn out that way. Regardless we went at like 4:30pm on a Friday and it wasn't that busy which was great because we saw line up posters inside. The hot dogs were pretty delicious albeit smaller than expected (which is probably why they sell them in twos). The frosted orange was pretty great - like a creamsicle in drink form. If you wait a bit for it to melt it's perfect to eat with a spoon.

My wife, son, and I stopped here while in Atlanta. We have been told by multiple people how good it is and that it’s definitely a place we should check out. My wife ordered a burger and hotdog with onion rings, my son ordered a hot dog with fries, and I ordered a burger with fries. I can’t confidently say that it was anything spectacular but it was good and I’d visit again. It’s a greasy spoon, quick in/out burger joint. The staff was very friendly, establishment appeared to be clean, and there was more than enough parking. Congrats on so many years of success!

I was really excited to finally try The Varsity after hearing many great things about it. The place has plenty of parking and tables. The food was served quickly and was delicious. The onion rings were very greasy, but who cares? It's The Varsity! Also had the orange drink, it was good. Would definitely go back when in Atl.

We’ve been driving past this place for years on road trips and finally made the time to stop and check it out. It was awesome.
Congrats to them on 96 years of burgering success!
Staff was friendly and efficient and food was good. Plenty of parking. We will certainly be back.

name: Mary Mac's Tea Room
address: 224 Ponce De Leon Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30308, USA

reviews.text:
Amazing place with great atmosphere! The pot roast was succulent and so tender you just need a fork to eat it.

The chicken fried chicken is always a safe bet though I recommend getting the sauce on the side as it may be a tad too salty for some folks.

There's parking just behind and even waiting you get to try their sweet tea which is a nice icing of visiting.

If you're in Atlanta, I recommend you try this place out. You'll want to come back for seconds!

What can I say but phenomenal. Back in Atlanta again and I had to try out another soul food spot. This location, boasts food that is homemade and fresh. If you want an authentic dining, experience and food delivered with speed and efficiency, you must come here. I highly recommend it.  The peach 🍑 cobbler was off the chain. Where can you go and get food delivered in less than 3 minutes - see for yourself! By the way Simonia has superb customer service and always smiled and was prompt - stop by at your leisure and enjoy the ambience, serenity and welcoming environment which dates back to 1945!

Went to Mary Mac’s Tea Room for dinner along with my parents. We were surprised by the number of famous celebrities and politicians that had eaten here throughout the years. With such an extensive menu, we initially didn’t know what to order. Our server recommended the southern special in which we could select 3 entrees, 3 sides and 3 deserts. We ended up getting fried chicken, meatloaf and Chicken & Dumplings for the entrees and for the sides: fried green tomatoes, broccoli casserole and grits. While all the items were good, it was the fried chicken that stood out the most. It was perfectly breaded, not too greasy and tasted amazing. Desert was also great with our choice  cobbler and pudding. We could definitely see why this place is really popular. A definitive recommendation for anyone visiting the ATL.

The food was great but just a bit salty for my taste.  It might be fine for others but salt is something I do not cook with, so I am very aware if it when others do!

This was my first time here even though I have driven past HUNDREDS if times!  Very reasonably priced considering their popularity!

I really don’t get the bad reviews because the food and service were AMAZING! Seasoning was perfect, and the portions are huge. It’s like having Thanksgiving dinner. You feel like your right at home with the southern hospitality. First time here visiting from Florida but will 100% come back if I’m ever in town again.

name: STATS Brewpub
address: 300 Marietta St NW Suite 101, Atlanta, GA 30313, USA

reviews.text: I'm gonna be honest, I did not have high expectations coming into this place only because this restaurant was a second choice option after our first option closed unexpectedly early, but it was meant to be. The food here is absolutely out of this world. The lemon pepper chicken wings are the best I've ever had! The Korean BBQ ribs had a perfect smokiness to them and you get a large portion of them as well. The desert selection was phenomenal and if you're into beer, well, they have tons of that as well. Absolutely blown away by what an unassuming brewpub in downtown can provide in terms of flavor. I recommend to anyone who is visiting from out of town!

I haven't been to STATS in a few years but the upstairs is to die for! The draft beer was plentiful and the service from servers and bartenders were superb. He raved about the chicken and hamburger sliders. But their Bourbon Bread Pudding is to die for. Me and hubby are already planning our next outing here!

Parking: There is ample street parking and garages nearby. Prices may fluctuate depending on if some events are happening at Mercedes Benz and State Farm.
Thank you to our server for making our experiance in Atlanta a memorable one!! The drinks were amazing, food was delicious, and Fries were amazing!!
Not our first time here. Their wings are good, pretzels, burgers, etc. It’s fun to sit at a brewery and we tried a flight. My family thinks their burgers are some of the best around.

What’s the difference between Wendy’s Dave’s Double and STATS double cheeseburger? About 11 dollars.

Burger and fries indistinguishable from fast food.

Disappointingly short menu. Maybe we got the lunch menu? What we got does not march the menus shown on Google maps.

Wings were pretty good, crispy, and came out fast. Everything else was slow.

We order food and drinks twice, and the food came first both times. At lunch time.

Waitress was nice and did fine, but hard to get a hold of when we needed her.

Beer nothing to write home about. Small selection for a brewery. Only big name options outside their own brews. Only one IPA available.

Huge restaurant, clean, average sports bar decor.

STATS… come hungry, leave hungry!

Would not consider going again.

name: Hard Rock Cafe
address: 215 Peachtree St, Atlanta, GA 30303, USA

reviews.text: I was here visiting for the Steelers & Falcons game over the weekend and came to the Hard Rock Saturday and Destiny the waitress was GREAT! The wings were to die for and the rib meal was excellent as well. We returned Sunday after the game, had to get some more of those wings. We sat at the bar and Cody the bar tender was EXCELLENT! She had superb customer service for as busy as the area was she continued to make sure everything was good. When I visit again I will return.

**Hard Rock Cafe Atlanta Downtown: Mediocre**

Nestled in the heart of Atlanta's bustling downtown, Hard Rock Cafe offers a familiar interior with plenty of rock memorabilia and music memorabilia adorning its walls.

The atmosphere is vibrant, with a lively bar area featuring numerous TVs for sports enthusiasts. Additionally, a souvenir shop is conveniently located on-site, offering a wide selection of iconic Hard Rock merchandise.

While the food may fall short of expectations, it's worth mentioning that I opted to venture beyond the usual American fare. The salmon was surprisingly decent, though the accompanying potatoes left much to be desired.

However, the nachos proved to be a major disappointment. Despite being listed as an appetizer, they were priced as an entree. The flavors were bland and the chips were old.

The drinks were equally mediocre, with nothing particularly noteworthy. If you're seeking exceptional cocktails or craft beer, you'd be better served elsewhere.

In conclusion, Hard Rock Cafe Atlanta Downtown fails to live up to its iconic status. While the interior and atmosphere are enjoyable, the food and beverages lack the quality that one would expect from such a well-known establishment.

Isn't what used to be.
No more memorabilia. Just a few things around.
The environment has changed. I guess everything changed after the pandemic. No more Harley at the entry door. They remodeled the place and took the vintage vibe away.
Food is still good enough.
Be sure they do not seat you all at the back of the place.
Great food, at least.💝

Food was great but the service was non existent almost. Other servers were going to their tables over n over but our waitress only showed up 3 times!! We had to ask the person that brought the food to get our waitress! She had no other tables so she should have been available and she did NOT once refill our drinks!

Here in Atlanta for a conference.  I went to the aquarium with friends because my youngest son, Paris, loved marine life.  🐬 He passed away 9 months ago at 29 years of age. Then my friends and I decided to get dinner at HardRock Cafe and it was delicious!  Our server was wonderful!  I've placed a heart around their name on my receipt.   💕😔

name: The Sun Dial Restaurant, Bar & View
address: 210 Peachtree St NW, Atlanta, GA 30303, USA

reviews.text: This place was IMMACULATE! Tell a friend to tell a friend this is perfect for a date night, birthday dinner YOU NAME IT. The vibes were everything & the VIEW??!? I love it I love it! Such a wonderful place with such amazing staff. Everyone there was so kind and friendly & the food was delicious. 100000000000000000/10. I will definitely be back!

I had my birthday here for the first time this weekend and enjoyed the experience! I do wish that the Sun Dial still rotated as it once did, but the views were still quite beautiful. We were lucky enough to see a rainbow over the nearby towers.

The food was excellent. Fresh bread with honey truffle butter, 9/10. The red snapper was excellent, perfectly cooked fish meets a lobster corn chowder sauce, 10/10. The duck was okay, it needed additional seasoning, 7/10. The strawberry cake dessert had a great strawberry compote/sauce, but the cake itself was quite dense and gluey, 7/10.

Some of the furnishings here are a bit dated. I think it makes it feel more classic, but I can see them needing some upgrades soon.

Fantastic experience for a small birthday group post-renovation. There is no better night time view of the city lights of Atlanta. The food is excellent, as are their cocktails and frozen drinks, alcohol choice overall is fantastic. The entrees are exquisite, the deserts very tasty, the restaurant is sparkling clean and the service is very professional. Highly recommend to all. To gain entrance to the elevator to the Sundial Restaurant, all reservation party members must be present. Online reservations worked like a charm.

Improved from pre-pandemic.

Previously, among my friends, this has always been a place for great views and good, but not great food. I would come here or the lounge several times a year. My daughter loves this place. But the lounge and restaurant were closed for an extended period. The restaurant is open and we returned.

The atmosphere is the same; classic, upscale and a great view. It no longer rotates, so we walked around the deck for a bit after dinner. The lounge is still closed.

The service and clientele has shifted a bit. Service is more personal and friendly. My server, Billy, was great. I can't think of a single thing that I'd change. He was there when I needed something. He was friendly and attentive to dietary restrictions, my kids needs and more.

They require that you buy an entree, which are about $70 each. This weeds out a lot of the more casual patrons that often came here in t-shirts and shorts after a nearby game for a drink while they rotated around the view.

The food is better than pre-pandemic. They have changed chefs. This food is more complex and refined. My duck had a great seasoning. The greens were also very good. My kid had chicken fingers and fries which were generous and she loved them.

It has rebranded itself from a tourist spectacle into a more refined upscale restaurant.

The best dinner with a view in Atlanta!! We had Ms.Ann as our server & she was GREAT. We took our son for his first birthday and had a great private dinner with him. Our server was so friendly, funny and helpful with menu selections. She even took our picture at the table for our special dinner. Only down side was the food did take quite a bit to be served. But overall great place, it did seem a bit to quiet for kids in my opinion so I’d only recommend brining well behaved children!

name: The Vortex
address: 438 Moreland Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30307, USA

reviews.text: The Vortex is a burger joint you won't want to miss! Their Blue Shroom burger was perfectly cooked, and the tots were crispy and amazing. Loved the wings and fried pickles too. Our bartender, Shannon, helped me with fantastic beers recommendations. Great food, service, and atmosphere. A must-try in Atlanta! I will definitely be back.

This place is so cool. The food was wonderful. My daughters had burgers and I had a Rueben. OMG…Best Rueben ever. I’m back in Texas dreaming about it. And the drinks are on point!  If you’re in midtown Atlanta this is a must try. No kids..Adults only.

My son and I stopped for lunch.  This has a cool,  and a little macabre decor. But,  I enjoy that stuff.  It is a bit different in expectations of attendance of the staff.  But,  they state that right in the menu,  it make take a few minutes,  just relax,  and if that bothers you,  it probably isn't the place for you.  For us,  it was all good as we could just chat.

The food was pretty darn good.  Granted,  we only had burgers, but it was one of the better burgers either of us have had.  The staff was friendly,  and the food came out expeditiously.  I would recommend this bar and grill to anyone.  Just one point,  it is 21 and over,  so leave the young ones at home.

Had a great time at The Vortex with fantastic staff and service. Loved the Pickle Rick burger & tots. Co-workers enjoyed hell & boring burgers. All happy members of the clean plate club. Good food, reasonable bill. Highly recommend a visit!

Finally had the opportunity and made it to the Vortex L5P - only been trying since 1996!  Have been looking forward to eating here for years.  Saturday around 8ish. Restaurant atmosphere is a lot of fun and well - awesome.  Was hopping to take in the full Vortex experience and sit in the main downstairs dining area but was told by staff tables are full (saw few empty tables). Which was a bummer but understandable.  We were sat quickly. Sat in upstairs patio area. Had a nice view of L5P.

The server took our order for food and drinks.  Apps came out fairly quick. Burgers took some time to come out. Server came to the table once and was not very attentive. Drinks were empty.    Went to downstairs bar to reorder drinks as our server was a no show. My burger and tots were cold and the others food was lukewarm. My fault - didn’t say anything to the server. The burgers were fine - definitely not the best burger around.

Service and bar tender at downstairs bar was great!

Overall disappointed. Waited all this time and ended up with cold food and service that was worse.

From the reviews this sounds like a one off and most people have a great experience.

name: TWO urban licks
address: 820 Ralph McGill Blvd NE, Atlanta, GA 30306, USA

reviews.text: Great dining experience! The restaurant is huge, busy and vibrant. We chose to sit at the bar and enjoyed everything that we ordered. The service was friendly and attentive, some nice live music which can make it hard to have conversations depending on where you sit. A nice place to meet friends, date nights in Atlanta.

The food at Two Urban Licks never disappoints! We savored the calamari, salmon chips, chicken, greens, mac 'n cheese, and brisket empanadas—each dish was bursting with flavor. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.

The atmosphere was calm and inviting, perfect for unwinding after a long day. We went for an early dinner, so there was no wait, and the food arrived promptly. Our server was friendly and attentive, adding to the overall great experience.

I highly recommend this spot, whether for date night, a gathering with friends, or just a casual outing. You won't be disappointed!

We had a chance to hang out with some family members, so we decided to go here. I had never been, but some of my other family members had been a long time ago, so I really didn't know what to expect. We drove in the parking lot to park, and we found out that they had valet parking. It's was only 3 dollars to park, and they accepted all types of payments, so that was a plus.  When we finally got inside of the restaurant it was a very nice atmosphere... A couple of our group members were late, so we were able to sit at the bar, and the people were so nice. We finally got seated, and our waiter Patrick came over and introduced himself. He was very informative and just overall a pretty nice guy. All of the food and drinks were amazing. I got the red Snapper, and it was amazing. The only thing I can say was wrong is that one of my family members didn't get some of the items he had ordered when his food came out. Other than that, everything was perfect 👌🏿.

My sister took me here for my Bday celebration. I turned 40 this year so it was a major milestone for me. Everything was so special and beautiful. The food was delicious. We had the chicken skins, she has mac & cheese and I had the shrimp pasta. Man oh man was it good. The chicken skins had me for a loop. I was like “ This shouldn’t be this good. Drinks were good except for one. But weren’t coming back again. This was our first time.

This is the second time I’ve been here and it was even better than the last. I highly recommend this establishment is you love a wide range of wine selection. It’s a great date night spot, my server was well informed and super friendly. She was able to recommend what I should try based off of what flavors I  told her I like. They had live music and it was super easy going. The food is just amazing and comes out so fast. I highly recommend Two Urban Licks if you want to go out to a finer dining experience in Atlanta without absolutely breaking the bank.

name: Ray's In the City
address: 240 Peachtree St, Atlanta, GA 30303, USA

reviews.text: Rose was my server and made very excellent suggestions. I walked in and she was the first person I met as the hostess was taking pictures for other customers. Right off the bat, Rose suggested the goat and pimento cheese fritters, which were delicious. When the hostess was able to seat me it was in Rose’s area so lucky me! In addition to the fritters I ordered the broiled seafood platter with garlic green beans and the fig old fashioned. I thoroughly enjoyed my time spent and the meal I had. I’m so glad I stopped by.

My husband reserved us a table here for my birthday. Ms. Tee was very welcoming and informative of the menu which helped us decide on a delicious spread for the night. She was very attentive to our needs and overall the night was so pleasurable. My birthday dinner was a great one. Thank you for your hospitality Tee. We will be back :) The food was AMAZING , fresh and cooked to perfection! Compliments to the team.

Ordered the scallops and they were very salty. The crab cake was alright, not that great. My guest ordered New York strip steak and had to send it back, ordered medium well and they brought medium rare. The waiter was okay, a little sassy and told my guest that she ordered one thing and not the other, instead of just doing the fake customer service thing, apologize and  just take the plate away to be recooked. Didn’t care for his attitude. I’m not sure if he had RBF or just rude. It wasn’t busy at all. We were the only ones there at first. The spinach was the only thing that was really good. Key lime pie was too bitter and forced myself to eat most of it. Also the bone marrow butter which is an extra $12 was nothing but regular butter, they need to do better. The other staff there was very nice and professional. Atmosphere was nice, but I  don’t recommend and won’t be going back.

I celebrated my anniversary with my boyfriend here. Everyone was so nice to us and we even got a free slice of  red velvet cake for our celebration. The food was absolutely delicious a bit pricey but definitely worth it.

4 stars for the atmosphere only because they don't uphold their own dress code. We saw several people wearing shorts and baseball caps. The steak was one of the best I have ever had, and I have had a lot of steak. The bread was to die for. Jade's service was impeccable(I believe I remember her name correctly). She was a fabulous representative of the restaurant and of a fine dining experience.

name: The Vortex Bar & Grill
address: 878 Peachtree St NW, Atlanta, GA 30309, USA

reviews.text: The food was amazing, the burgers were so juicy and meaty. The staff was super attentive and very nice! The order came out at a reasonable time and we were a really big party. This was definitely an alternative restaurant and it’s not like every other restaurant you go to get a burger, but it’s definitely one of my favorites now when going to Atlanta.

This was an amazing first-time experience! We visited on a Saturday afternoon and were pleasantly surprised by the lack of wait time. Our waitress, Ashley, was outstanding—very helpful and attentive. The cheeseburger was perfectly prepared, big, and juicy. The plantains were full of flavor. And the Buffalo wings? The best I've had in Atlanta so far. This place is a must-try!

It was delicious! We loved it!! Fries were just very regular plain fries I think they could do a better job and have a much more unique french fry to make them taste so much better. I got the come'on awana lei U burger, it was delicious!!! Sorry about the spelling not sure let's not listed below so I had to add it to my review!

Stopped in for lunch and man, it didn’t disappoint. The lady behind the bar was very friendly and personable.

We enjoyed the beer and burgers while in. Highly recommend this place for a great burger! Bring your ID as it is 18 and over only!

We typically ally frequent the vortex in little 5 points but were checking out the comedy club so decided to dine here. Food is good. We prefer the decor at L5P. I didn’t like all the framed photos of bugs
And spiders so close to the table. Yuck! What a way to destroy an appetite. I had to stay turned to not look at the ugly bugs. Service was fine.

name: Six Feet Under Pub & Fish House - Grant Park
address: 437 Memorial Dr SE Suite #1A, Atlanta, GA 30312, USA

reviews.text:
Our server was very pleasant &  helpful in making a recommendation for sides, the corn did was new to me and tasty. Overall, the food was yummy. It was suggested to add a lil butter garlic seeding to add some flavor pop to the spinach ✅. Definitely recommend.

We set an on the outdoor patio on an overcast day,  it was spacious,  clean, no music, but perfect.

This is my go to seafood sit down restaurant. If you visit during the week around lunch time it's never that busy. The weekend evenings are typically packed. The food is worth every penny you will spend. I've never had bad service from the greeters at the door to the wait staff. Everything is always amazing! I especially love the fried catfish and buffalo shrimp appetizer. The sauce is perfect! The drinks are AMAZING!!! I realize I typically give a lot of stars but this restaurant deserves every single one of them. I frequently visit because of the food, staff, and great atmosphere!

AMAZING! The food was amazing, so fresh, amazing portion sizes, our waiter Anthony was great, super attentive, friendly and knowledgeable. The catfish nuggets were so fresh, the lemonade was the bomb, and the tacos were sensational. I will be back!!

This place did not disappoint! What a wonderful way to spend a Sunday and to wind down from all of life’s activities. Definitely recommend anything seafood on the menu. Jamie, our server was top-notch, very attentive, personable, and deserves all of the accolades. Don’t wait to visit this place. All food CONSUMED! Lol It’s a hidden gem that, maintains it original purpose. Grant Park STRONG 👊🏽👊🏽👊🏽

I’ve visited the Oakland Cemetery couple times and would always see this restaurant. Finally got to try it and I hate that I was a bit disappointed. Service was great, loved the atmosphere—-but the food was just not tasty. My fried catfish was just bland. Fish tacos were on the bland side as well. The sauces it as accompanied with didn’t help much. The sauce from the calamari was a much better company with the fried fish.  My favorites were the kid’s cheeseburger and calamari, it was extra crunchy just the way I prefer it. I’d come back and try other dishes.

name: South City Kitchen Midtown
address: 1144 Crescent Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30309, USA

reviews.text: The ambiance was pleasant, with a cozy patio and delicious food. Our server was very sweet and attentive. We especially enjoyed the taste of the food and cocktails. We ordered the duck breast and the pork belly appetizer. While the taste was good, the portions were disappointingly small—there were only three tiny pieces of pork belly on the plate. The duck breast entree was excellent though!

What a phenomenal gem in the heart of Atlanta. You begin your culinary journey with the best cornbread I've ever had. Even the butter that's served with is thought out and elegantly whipped to adorn the airy nature of the bread. Followed by a crab bisque soup which gets a layer of crab crowning the bowl that you wish you could just have to sustain life from that point forward. Then the fried chicken livers come and it makes you grateful the least expensive ingredients  can be the most amazing. The garnish, if you can call it that, that's served so thoughtfully alongside the lump crab cake, could be a dish unto itself.  The combination of the sprinkling of red pepper throughout the crab cake and the little kick from the spicy mayo is countered with the citrus, almost berry like pickle on the carrot slaw and baby green garnish. Then you arrive at the fried chicken entree and your life is complete. It's not so much served with a gravy as it is more similar to a sweet demiglaze that makes the mash and collards it is served with one cohesive delicious bite. I could not recommend a restaurant higher in any city I've been in. Many thanks to chef and the amazing staff represented by Eva at my table. Go, go, go and partake in this elevated southern cuisine.

Food was delicious. Everything from the steak to the seafood was cooked well, tender and not overdone. Seasoned and well flavored.
My favorites were the Carolina trout, the sck crab cake, as well as the chicken liver appetizer. A table favorite was the fried green tomatoes.
Our server was very welcoming and friendly, even going above and beyond in providing extra bread, chatting with us about why we were in town, and even an extra peach for our salad.
The dishes are a bit pricey but well worth it if you are looking to treat yourself.
Would like to return when we are in town again.

I had the pleasure of going here last night with my family, two of which were here from out of state. We all loved the food and the service! We had Kenya and she was an absolute DREAM! She was attentive, helpful and knowledgeable. This was our first time and not our last. I will also mention that I did have a bad encounter with a waiter that did not service our table... The restaurant is very tight and my daughter and I were walking back to our patio seat from the inside bathroom. The tall waiter with long dreads turned and bumped into us and looked at my daughter and I and rolled his eyes and made a scoff sound even though I was apologetic and we weren't the ones in the wrong. The good still outweighed the bad because of KENYA and because the food and drinks were all amazing. So the 5 star rating is still deserving.

Brilliant place, so happy to find it: the servers (including Rachel) all such kind and attentive souls. The food was delicious, and the atmosphere was wonderful. The team all work well together and it was a joy to be here and partake of some delicious southern fried chicken! My only wish is that I could come back and try the rest of the menu.

name: Max Lager's Wood-Fired Grill & Brewery
address: 320 Peachtree Rd NE, Atlanta, GA 30308, USA

reviews.text:
Really great restaurant with easy access in downtown.  Food was retty good.  Fried Okra and Southern Fried Chicken was delicious.  There was a lot of liquid so the potatoes were like gravy and the collard greens had big stem chunks that weren't edible.

The manager greeted everyone on arrival but I wish he would have moved around the restaurant more.  The section I was in had a server who was struggling and needed support.  I never got a drink or a chance to order the food I was going to take with me.  There were 4 tables waiting for checks more than 20 min and more tables needing bussed while the line was out the door.

I would visit again.  I think it was just some missed logistics tonight.

At Max Lager's, I embarked on a culinary journey that ranged from sublime to disappointing. The shrimp dish that my wife ordered was a symphony of flavors which left an indelible mark on my taste buds. Succulent shrimp, delicately seasoned and perfectly cooked, danced on my palate with each bite. Accompanied by a tantalizing sauce that struck a harmonious balance between tangy and savory, this dish was an absolute triumph.

Next, I delved into their steak selection, and I was met with sheer delight. The steak, cooked to perfection according to my specifications, boasted a charred exterior that gave way to tender, juicy meat with every forkful. Each bite was a testament to the chef's mastery of the grill, leaving me longing for more even after the last morsel was gone.

However, the journey took a detour when I sampled the mashed potatoes. While they were passable, they lacked the creamy richness and depth of flavor that one would expect from a top-tier restaurant. Their mediocrity was a stark contrast to the culinary excellence exhibited elsewhere on the menu, leaving me underwhelmed and longing for more.

The disappointment continued with the undercooked green beans, which failed to reach the desired level of tenderness. Their raw crunchiness detracted from the overall dining experience, casting a shadow over the otherwise stellar meal.

To conclude the evening, we shared and indulged in a slice of red velvet cake, only to be met with disappointment once again. The cake, while visually appealing, was served cold, robbing it of the moist, decadent texture that defines a true red velvet masterpiece. It was a lackluster finale to an otherwise memorable meal.

In summary, Max Lager's showcased culinary prowess with its shrimp dish and steak, but faltered with its mashed potatoes, undercooked green beans, and cold red velvet cake. While the highs were undeniably high, the lows served as a reminder that even the finest establishments have room for improvement.

I’d love to come back to witness an improved experience.

King

My first visit and definitely will be back!

I had fish and chips; it was perfect with great tasting tarter sauce. My friend had steak and he was delighted with it.

Since I wasn't driving, I ordered a margherita. It was definitely the best 'rita I've  ever had!

Best of all...our server was the sweetest and most attentive I've ever had:  ETSA!!

Skip Mortons - Skip Ruth's Chris - this place is exceptional! Steak prepared to perfection,  Salmon was exceptional. From Peter at the host stand to Devin our waiter, service top notch!!! Great meal - you won't be dissapointed.

My family and I all met up in Atlanta to celebrate my parents’ 56th wedding anniversary. We initially had reservations at a different restaurant, but noticed Max Lagers right next to the hotel and decided to switch it up.

I am SO glad we did!  From the moment we walked in - 5 adults, 2 5-year-olds and an infant - we were treated incredibly well. Our server, Fabian, was beyond attentive and so patient. The food was excellent - everyone was happy with their meals, from sirloin to salad to seafood.

We were so delighted that we went back again tonight.

Highly recommended the fried cheesecake (pictured) and the bread pudding!

name: Fox Bros. Bar-B-Q
address: 1238 DeKalb Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30307, USA

reviews.text: We had a fantastic experience at Fox Bros. Bar-B-Q for our first visit. Despite the beautiful weather outside, we chose to dine indoors to avoid the flies. Our server was attentive and provided excellent service. The food runners and the server's assistant were also on top of their game. The drinks were incredibly refreshing, and I opted for the 2 meats & 2 sides, which did not disappoint. The food was absolutely delicious, and I had no complaints whatsoever. The collard greens, coleslaw, and mac n cheese were all outstanding and served in generous portions. The ribs and brisket were cooked to perfection and bursting with flavor. Needless to say, we will definitely be returning

Food came out super fast
Server is very attentive
Reasonable price

We got fried chicken ribs which is actually pork ribs. It was good, crispy not oily. We also got 3 combinations; ribs, wings and brisket with sides of collard greens and coleslaw. Ribs were delicious and easy to take the meat out of the bone. Chicken wings with spicy sauce was also good. For beef brisket you can choose between lean or fatty part. We got the lean part. I was little upset with collard greens. It’s very salt. However, coleslaw was tasty. My son ordered pulled pork sandwich. He enjoyed it. I tasted some pulled pork I think it’s a little salty for me.

I love the smoked wings. This is one of few restaurants that let me order all drummettes....and without an uncharge! Oh my, the tater tots were absolutely delicious  and crispy!

Hubby had wings and fried okra. Check out the photo to see our they make their okra (in strips)

Cornbread was a bit dry.

My first time sitting down here: and my first time back in a very long time. They did not disappoint !!!  All the food came fast and was delicious, hot and fresh. The ribs were so tinder. Of course we had to try most the sides/ please get the baked beans. The collards were exceptional as well! The fries were fried to perfection! Everything was seasoned perfectly! Will def be coming back if we’re craving bbq. We had the special watermelon margarita and it was 11/10 we could tell it was made with real watermelon
We had to fried pickles for an appetizer and they were seasoned and fried perfectly, batter wasn’t too thick and the slices were the perfect size !

Fox Bros BBQ: A Savory Haven in Atlanta

Fox Bros BBQ in Atlanta, Georgia, delivers a commendable dining experience with a menu that impresses even the most discerning barbecue aficionados. My recent visit was a testament to their dedication to quality and flavor.

The ribs, the star of the show, were seasoned and cooked to near perfection. Despite arriving later in the evening and finding them a tad dried out, the rich, smoky flavors still shone through, highlighting the skill and expertise behind the grill.

Complementing the ribs was the jalapeno cornbread, a delightful blend of spice and sweetness that balanced the meal beautifully. Initially, I was skeptical about the macarons, thinking they might be dry based on their appearance, but I was pleasantly surprised by their moist, flavorful texture.

The greens, although meatless, were a standout with their well-crafted seasoning that offered a hearty, satisfying taste. Each bite was a reminder of the thoughtful preparation that goes into the sides at Fox Bros BBQ.

The ambiance at Fox Bros is equally inviting, with a welcoming series and staff that make you feel right at home. Special mention goes to my server, Patrick, whose attentive service added a personal touch to the experience.

In conclusion, Fox Bros BBQ is a must-visit for barbecue lovers in Atlanta. Despite a minor hiccup with the ribs, the overall quality of food and service ensures I will be back. I rate my experience a solid 4 out of 5 stars.

name: McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks
address: 190 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, GA 30303, USA

reviews.text: Decided to try this place out before a concert at State Farm Arena. Service, drinks and food were all good. I had the green pea risotto with scallops. I added the lobster tail. The seafood was cooked well by the risotto was just so so. I was a little surprised as they were not busy and had time to get it right. Overall not bad meal. My girlfriend had the shrimp and grits. It was great and I was a little jealous.

AJ, Brian, and Monté set the vibe. There was another server that recently relocated from Ohio was fabulous too!! The drinks and food were delicious 😋 Will make sure I stop here each time I visit the city!

I only have the atmosphere a 3 🌟 bc their were patrons that were disrespectful to me during my visit. That's not on the staff or business though. Just a warning for those that understand the assignment.

July 2024

I have not dined at McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks in many years where my wife wanted a romantic dinner on our first night in Atlanta. The place was not busy at all. We were seated at a table where the furniture looked dated except the private booths.  The lighting was way too bright for business dinner restaurant.

The menu had some nice offerings and decided on the Parmesan Crusted Flounder which included Piccata Style Shrimp, Mashed Potatoes, and Asparagus. Our waitress was so so where did not really add to the experience dining here. When my food arrived I noticed two large pieces of fish. I was also surprised to see three huge shrimp on top of it. I rather just have the fish.  The asparagus looked awful and stayed away from it. The flounder tasted good where the crust needed a bit more flavor but did complement well with the mashed potatoes.

Overall expected more from McCormick & Schmick's.

The atmosphere was nice, except when a random kid came into the establishment yesterday with music blasting and said "this place ain't for me". It was odd. Also, I went to use the bathroom and the lady bartender took my drink and removed it from my table. She apologized when I got back and said she didn't know that I went to the bathroom. The lobster bisque that I had tasted good, but when I was swishing it around, I could see layers of oil. I had a male bartender before the female bartender started serving me and he made me a great drink and served me well. I wish I could've had a better experience here. I won't be back.

Went to this spot before a concert at the arena. Food was delicious! Drinks were incredible. Service was decent but they had lots of newer staff so it took some time to get menu questions answered. The atmosphere was a mixed bag. Because of the concert ahead of time there were some people who were a little more rowdy than I would expect at a place that expensive.

name: Sotto Sotto Restaurant
address: 313 North Highland Avenue Northeast, Atlanta, GA 30307, USA

reviews.text: What an amazing experience from start to finish. Visiting from out of town and wanted to find a good dinner spot open late on Sundays. The atmosphere was so lovely- soft jazz, pretty table settings, kind staff.  We also were so lucky to have the best server, Elizabeth, who was so knowledgeable and friendly. They also offered delicious gluten free pasta. Everything was wonderful quality. Highly recommend!

You wouldn’t even know this place exist it’s so tucked away but the menu is amazing, the patio is beautiful. Everything I had was absolutely amazing, knowledgeable server was very nice! Def look forward to coming back

A real gem in a lovely neighborhood. Food was excellent, service was awesome. I had an excellent beef carpaccio followed by a no-less excellent ravioli with meat filling, sage and butter (very different name on the menu)  and a little piece of heaven in my mouth: their chocolate strataciella gelato. Divine!!!

I will say seafood is not their forte which is unfortunate. The seafood linguine was very mediocre, dry and tasteless. We also ordered an asparagus risotto and it was tasty but extremely overpowering with salt. They accidentally brought a mushroom risotto and again, very tasty but also very salty. The beet salad was great but didn’t impress me. The panna cotta was also pretty tasteless.  Would I go back and try other things? Absolutely! The service was spectacular and the ambiance was beautiful. Had high expectations but was slightly disappointed…
The food and the service was excellent, we throughly enjoyed sharing half plates with the perfect portions. The outside patio welcomes a lot of bugs, to be cautious.

name: Ecco Midtown
address: 40 7th St NE, Atlanta, GA 30308, USA

reviews.text:
One of my favorite happy hour spaces in Atlanta. Have been there for dinner a couple of times and it’s always been great. But I particularly like their happy hour at the bar. The bartenders were super friendly.
The Dogfish Head 60 Minute Rarebit was just divine. Sourdough bread with melted cheese and a mouth watering sauce.
Their wine selection is great and one item not on the happy hour menu but definitely not be be missed is the Fried Goat Cheese.

The food was great. But the service wasn't quite there yet. We would've wished our waiter have warn us about the portion size of our desert, because my colleague and I each ordered a dessert (we got a total of 2 desserts), but when they came, it looks like they can feed 4-5 people.

Great experience.  Great service.  Great location.  Love the inside. We had fried goat cheese,  Wood Roasted Shrimp for appetizers. The goat cheese with the honey grizzle added great flavor. The fish of the day was Pompano, and my daughter  had the Duck Breast. Both dishes were  cooked to perfection.  The mixed  drinks  weren't  watered down. They have a military  discount  too. A must  visit  if you're  visiting  Atlanta.

Beautiful restaurant, good service, lackluster food.

The atmosphere is totally on point! I felt like a million bucks walking into this place. It’s a vibe!

I only ordered the shrimp appetizer and a side of broccolini. Neither dish made me smile🤷🏽‍♀️
I felt like the menu is severely limited and over priced (see menu below).

I would return on a day when the food isn’t my priority and I just want to be somewhere really cool.

Ecco Midtown is an upscale restaurant in Midtown, but the prices are a little more reasonable (in terms of serving size to price ratio) than other upscale establishments.

Everything I had a chance to sample tasted very good.  Also, I like that the servings are not so tiny that they leave you hungry.  If you’re a first time visitor, the waitstaff does a great job with food recommendations from the menu.  Everything our waitress recommended was on point.  Pro-tip:  THIS IS A CASHLESS establishment, so bring your credit cards!

The ambience is cozy and intimate.  The dress code is smart casual.  There is valet parking on site, but there are plenty of street parking  available on Cypress and surrounding streets (just pay with ParkMobile app).

Notable appetizers to try are honey goat cheese and pork belly.  The goat cheese and the honey are a great combination.  The pork belly is flavored to perfection.  I wish it comes in more than 2 small skewers on a small plate.  Other  notable side dishes are wood roasted shrimp and pan con tomate, both of which are delicious.

Notable drinks I’d recommend are the “Long Live the Queen” and “Pink Panther.”  Both of which are good.

The restaurant ran out of its most popular entree, the papardelle, on the Saturday evening I visited.  But nevertheless, the Spaghetti al nero (squid ink noodles in a slightly spicy blue crab sauce) the waitress recommended tasted exquisite.  My companions tried the campanelle (white chicken ragu) and loved it, too!

Overall, if you’re looking to experience a Midtown restaurant with exquisite tasting foods, great ambience, and friendly service that’s also big bang for your bucks, give Ecco a try.

name: Agave Restaurant
address: 242 Boulevard SE, Atlanta, GA 30312, USA

reviews.text: I was quite underwhelmed by the food at agave. The service we received was amazing and we were seated fairly quickly for a party of 6 on a Friday night with no reservations. While valet parking is offered, my party decided to self park on the back side of the parking area. I had the Fried Chicken and while it was good, it wasn’t anything amazing. My party decided to share 2 appetizers. The quesadilla didn’t have much flavor but it was pretty filling. The spring rolls were cooked well but required the pepper jelly to carry the flavor. Someone else in my party ordered dishes that came with Mac and cheese and it was mushy. However, the collard greens were really tasty. The steak dishes were done pretty well but once again, the accompaniments like the onion rings needed work. I’m not sure if I’d personally visit again because the meal was so lack luster. I think it could be a nice place to stop by for quick appetizers but I would definitely consider other options first.

I had the steak with collards and mashed potatoes. Sooooo so good. The collards were juicy and tender, the steak melted in my mouth and the potatoes were the perfect consistency. I also had a top shelf margarita which packed a punch. For dessert we had key lime pie. 😊

Parking is available but you have to valet. They take tips so it’s nothing extreme.

It was easy to make a reservation and
my server was amazing!

We had 30 women and the food was amazing! Drinks are refreshing. Dietary restrictions were met. The private room was beautiful, warm and cozy. Owner and son are charming and talented, thank you from the YWCA!

Agave's environment is that of a comfy/cozy low light vibe that can turn all the way up come happy hour and weekends. The staff hasn't ever disappointed and are always eager to tend to your requests. The food is upper echelon and always captivates as it sizzles on its plates. My go to is the Mac & Cheese with an order of fried calamari. I highly recommend to any calamari lovers.
I came with a large group to celebrate a birthday. The food was incredible, service was amazing, and the atmosphere was fun and enjoyable. Can’t recommend enough!

name: Ruth's Chris Steak House
address: Embassy Suites Hotel, 267 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, GA 30313, USA

reviews.text:
I thought all Ruth's Chris maintained the same degree of quality and service? While the steak here was decent, the rest was mediocre at best. The gumbo that was recommended was lacking that gumbo flavored and just tasted salty. The garlic mashed potatoes and creamed spinach were luke warm. The first batch of menus they gave us were also wet from a spilled drink. It could be because we came an hour before closing, but that's a horrible excuse when you pay the prices they charge. Also half the mints at the front had their wrapper broken. Overall a mediocre experience and one I won't be trying out again.

Oh the cheesecake was good.

My recent visit to Ruth's Chris Steak House was a mixed experience. The ambiance was pleasant, with a classy and comfortable setting, but it didn't stand out as particularly unique or memorable.

The menu featured a variety of steaks and side dishes. We ordered several sides to complement our meal:

- **Lobster Mac and Cheese ($27):** I would rate this a 6. It was decent but didn't have the rich, indulgent flavor I expected.
- **Mashed Potatoes ($14):** These were smooth and creamy, earning a rating of 7.
- **Sweet Potato Casserole ($15):** This dish was quite good, with a nice balance of sweetness and texture. I'd give it an 8.
- **Grilled Asparagus ($13):** Well-prepared but nothing extraordinary, so I rate it a 7.
- **Stuffed Mushrooms ($19):** These were flavorful and enjoyable, deserving an 8.
- **House Salad ($12):** Kind of small but had some nice flavors, earning an 8.

For the main course, I got the Cowboy Ribeye with shrimp. It was only seasoned with pepper and salt. I would have preferred a few more seasonings, such as garlic, onion, or maybe some seasoning salt. However, it was prepared perfectly.

We finished off with dessert and got the bread pudding with whiskey sauce, which was burned and didn't taste pleasant.

Overall, for spending over $1,000 for six people, we could have gone somewhere else and had better food. While the food and service were acceptable, they did not live up to the high expectations set by the restaurant's reputation. It's a decent option, but there are other steakhouses that offer a more memorable experience.

The steaks were very good, the drinks were top notch.  Pictured is their Old Fashion and a strawberry lemon drop martini.  The dessert kept this from a 5 star.  The bread pudding was cold as it had been waiting for service to bring it.

Service kinda lacked at the beginning, but the food and improvement in service made up for it. Steak was so damn good everyone really enjoyed their meals. Sides are family style so everyone can try everything.

First time visiting. The food was extremely bland with the exception of the sweet potato souffle and we tried a lot. I had the steak, lobster Mac and cheese, creamed spinach, asparagus, mashed potatoes, shrimps, house salad and
bread pudding. I enjoyed the mashed potatoes. The sweet potato souffle was too sweet. The shrimps were good. The lemon drop martini was just ok. Great customer. Table was too small for six people. We constantly dropped silverware because we had no room on the table. Unfortunately I will not be back.

name: Thrive
address: 101 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, GA 30303, USA

reviews.text: Decided to go here before a concert since it was close to the arena. The ambiance is nice. Great customer service. The food was delicious and the drinks were tasty. I had the chili lime wings and brussel sprouts. My friend had the tuna burger and fries. Will definitely be back!

Upon entering the restaurant, it's aesthetically pleasing, clean with a contemporary feel.

The host immediately asked if we had reservations (We did not) & promptly seated us.

Our server arrived ten minutes after we were seated & wasn't the friendliest. Our waters were brought out quickly although we waited almost twenty minutes for our food. I had to ask a different server twice to receive utensils.

(I'd like to note we dined here during the beginning of Atlanta's water crisis- Hence the paper plates)

For future reference I'd probably order takeout. Food was great!

Staffs are nice and food is not bad/good. The restaurant interior is beautiful and comfortable. However, I would highly recommend you beat the crowd to order, otherwise you could stuck there for 30 mins to 1hr with any food.
Be sure always expect a crowd due to there are so many concerts, conventions, or office ppl.
Sushi are a bit pricy here and mostly “American style”. Sandwiches and most appetizers are pretty good.

Totally recommend their happy hour drinks! It’s pretty good deal from 4-6 pm
Thank you to Ryan for accommodating us after a long travel day. I enjoyed the fresh meal and lovely drink. Can't wait to return.

Overall a 4. It exceeded my expectations. The price is a bit high but they are in downtown. They he food is a little better than average. Generally it was a bit too wet and saucy for me, but it was high quality and prepared well. The atmosphere was really great and the service from Kyla was exceptional. I’ll definitely go here again. The coffee was really good and everyone was very nice.

name: Shakespeare Tavern Playhouse
address: 499 Peachtree St NW, Atlanta, GA 30308, USA

reviews.text: The show was absolutely hilarious. I saw Merry Wives of Windsor last year and was very pleasantly surprised by how great the production was - and Midsummer Night's Dream blew it away. Two shows, two great performances, incredibly talented actors - I'll definitely be back!

Great value. Very organized all the way with a friendly staff. Interesting cozy setting for small groups with no bad seats in the house. Good food available at fair prices. Easy access by Marta metro. Overall a nice experience.

Our first time here and the 3 Mukesteers was a perfect choice for our tween and teen. I love the generous portion of the food and all come with a salad . We hope to come here more often. Thank you for sponsoring the opportunity for us to experience it through the library pass. Our children enjoyed and learnt alot.

We absolutely love it here. We come several times a year and always have a blast. The acting is fantastic and you see many of the same faces from play to play (or helping out with tickets / behind the bar / etc.!). Parking is easy and the building has great air conditioning. We love the atmosphere and appreciate how it was designed after the original Globe theatre, as well as the commitment to the original practice of the plays. Tickets are reasonably priced and easy to purchase on the website. Highly recommend!!

PS - don’t forget to check out the hilarious show-related memes printed on the back of the bathroom stall doors. 😊

This is a great place!  The shows are always well done and we have gone back several times.  They have a food counter with a full meal before the show and they offer desserts at intermission.

The performers are professional and the staging, music and acting are always very entertaining!  You will love your visit!
